        Is this a null or empty string?
        Parameters:
        x - the string to test.
        Returns:
        true for yes, false for no.

      • asOptional

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> asOptional(java.lang.String x)
        Makes the given string an Optional.
        Parameters:
        x - the string to convert.
        Returns:
        empty if the argument is null or empty; otherwise the argument wrapped into an Optional.

      • write

        public static java.lang.String write(java.util.function.Consumer<java.io.PrintWriter> writer)
        Gives a Consumer a PrintWriter to write some text to.
        Parameters:
        writer - the consumer that will produce the text.
        Returns:
        the text produced by the consumer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

        message - optional exception message; ignored if null or empty.

      • requireStrings

        public static void requireStrings(java.lang.String[] xs)
        Throws an exception if the argument is null or has zero length or any of the elements is null or empty.
        Parameters:
        xs - the array to test.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null or has zero length or any of the components is null or empty.

      • readAsString

        public static java.lang.String readAsString(java.io.InputStream source)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the whole input into a UTF-8 string.
        Parameters:
        source - the data to read; the stream will be closed when this method returns, even if an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        the whole content of the stream as a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the stream.

      • readAsString

        public static java.lang.String readAsString(java.lang.Readable source)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the whole input into a UTF-8 string.
        Parameters:
        source - the data to read; the source will be closed when this method returns, even if an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        the whole input data provided by the source as a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading from the source.

      • lines

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> lines(java.lang.String text)
        Breaks up the given text into lines.
        Parameters:
        text - the input text.
        Returns:
        the sequence of lines making up text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null .

      • unlines

        public static java.lang.String unlines(java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> lines)
        Appends a new line separator to each stream elements and then joins them into a single string. Any null or empty stream element will result in an empty line.
        Parameters:
        lines - the lines to join.
        Returns:
        the lines separated by a new line character into a single string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
